Package se.idsec.signservice.security.sign

Interface SignatureValidationResult

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultSignatureValidationResult
    public interface SignatureValidationResult
    Interface representing the (successful) result of a signature validation operation.
    Author:
    Martin Lindstr√∂m (martin@idsec.se), Stefan Santesson (stefan@idsec.se)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  SignatureValidationResult.Status
      Representation of the validation status of a signature.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      CertificateValidationResult getCertificateValidationResult()
      In case a successful certificate validation was performed, this method returns the result from this operation.
      Date getClaimedSigningTime()
      Gets the claimed signing time.
      Exception getException()
      If this status represents a non-successful result, this method may return an exception object describing the underlying validation error.
      String getSignatureAlgorithm()
      Gets the URI identifier of the signature algorithm.
      X509Certificate getSignerCertificate()
      Gets the certificate that was used to sign the validated document.
      SignatureValidationResult.Status getStatus()
      Gets the overall validation status.
      String getStatusMessage()
      Gets a status message.
      boolean isEtsiAdes()
      Predicate that tells if the signature that was validated is a signature according to the corresponding ETSI AdES signature profile.
      boolean isSuccess()
      Predicate that tells if this result object represents a successful validation.

    • Method Detail

      • getStatus

        SignatureValidationResult.Status getStatus()
        Gets the overall validation status.
        Returns:
        the validation status

      • isSuccess

        boolean isSuccess()
        Predicate that tells if this result object represents a successful validation.
        Returns:
        true if this result object represents a successful validation and false otherwise

      • getStatusMessage

        String getStatusMessage()
        Gets a status message. To be used for logging purposes.

        For non-successful results a message is always returned.

        Returns:
        status message

      • getException

        Exception getException()
        If this status represents a non-successful result, this method may return an exception object describing the underlying validation error.
        Returns:
        an exception describing the underlying error or null

      • getSignerCertificate

        X509Certificate getSignerCertificate()
        Gets the certificate that was used to sign the validated document.

        May be null in the rare cases when the certificate is not included in the signature, and when no validation certificates were supplied to the validation process.

        Returns:
        the signature certificate

      • getCertificateValidationResult

        CertificateValidationResult getCertificateValidationResult()
        In case a successful certificate validation was performed, this method returns the result from this operation.
        Returns:
        the certificate validation result

      • getSignatureAlgorithm

        String getSignatureAlgorithm()
        Gets the URI identifier of the signature algorithm.
        Returns:
        signature algorithm URI identifier

      • getClaimedSigningTime

        Date getClaimedSigningTime()
        Gets the claimed signing time.

        This is a signing time asserted within the signature, not asserted by any external time stamp service.

        Returns:
        the claimed signing time (if available)

      • isEtsiAdes

        boolean isEtsiAdes()
        Predicate that tells if the signature that was validated is a signature according to the corresponding ETSI AdES signature profile.
        Returns:
        true if this signature conforms to the ETSI AdES profile, and false otherwise
